### Doctoral student: Applied economics

<br>
<!-- <br> -->
<!-- <br> -->
<!-- <br> -->

Ed Rubin is a doctoral candidate in applied economics at UC Berkeley in the [Department of Agricultural and Resource Economics](https://are.berkeley.edu). His research interests include the economics of the environment, energy, and natural resources; inequality; health; and development. He is also interested in rural communities and agriculture, drug and criminal policies, and general empirical policy analysis (econometrics, statistics, machine learning, spatial analysis, _etc._).

Ed is a lover of data, (beautiful) graphs, maps, Venn diagrams, and people. He is an avid consumer of pizza, pho, tacos, coffee, and computational power. He is also a bunch of other things.

Please look around and/or [contact Ed](contact.html).
